comment.author: 13639096@N06
comment._content: Notice the VR (Victoria Regina) over the keystone, marking the reign in which a public bulding was built & put over every public building when I was a child (EIIR by then) "Designed by architect H A Wilshire and constructed in 1839 as a result of a competition organised by the NSW government architect. The dominant feature externally is the circular heads over openings, the most significant being the horseshoe shaped entrance which draws attention to the heavily moulded timber gates. The original governor's residence is at the right of the gates and is largely obscured by a large tree, but the gaol itself is easily visible to the public." (From www.check-in.com.au/Northern_Rivers/Grafton_Gaol.htm ) No doubt a terrible, terrible place if the notes on prison reform (ABC below) are anything to go on. www.abc.net.au/4corners/content/2005/20050711_supermax/pr...

comment.author: 59604254@N08
comment._content: I beg to differ the construction date of the gaol in the above post by MargaretsFamily. I refer the website www.clarencehistory.org.au/timeline.html The timeline indicates 1893 the Gaol was opened. I also have a similar photograph as shown here and, on it it clearly states "1893".

comment.author: 13639096@N06
comment._content: Thanks for that, Jacaranda Kid. Oh the evanescence of web sites. I tried to go to the sites I had found. Not possible. I went to www.clarencehistory.org.au/timeline.html, which says the gaol was opened in 1893. The site below investigator.records.nsw.gov.au/Entity.aspx?Path=\Agency\437 reckons that it was put out for tender and the tender accepted in 1893. So thanks again, Jacaranda Kid.
